text:
I draw everyday since I'm 8, and I read and write stories since i'm 10. But I am also the kind of person who can't spend a day without discovering and learning new thing about the world and its people.  Moreover, I couldn't see myself studying specifical subjects at college (such as litterature, art, or science knowing the fact that i sucks with that subject).  So when I discovered Infocom in Rennes2, I imediately saw the perfect mix between the three subjects that kept me interested in studying at college.
I just started studying Infocom. I've learnt that communication is the transmission of messages between two elements. Communication is necessary in everyday life, at work, with marketing, or even psychology. That's  why I think communication will be useful for my future job. Indeed, I want to become an art director, I want to lead a team for huge artistic projetcs. I just could have chosen to study art in a private school to become a graphic designer and then an art director (This path is the most common after all). But how will I be able to lead a team, to interact with other companies, to deal with sponsorships, to travel all around the world, if I am not mastering the way of communication ? I may be wrong but I think- I believe i made a good choice. My path will be different from the other's, but it's for the best.
That's the reason i've chosen to study Infocom. I'll be an artist, for whom communication and then marketing won't be hard things to deal with.
